alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 02 at 1:33PM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Marys River Near Deeth affecting Elko County. .Warm temperatures will melt high mountain snowpack and increase river flows. For the Marys River...including Test - Charleston, Charleston, Deeth...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Marys River Near Deeth. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 6.8 feet, Minor to moderate lowland flooding occurs on lower Mary`s river, with flooding of many rural roads near the river. Some streets in Deeth flood, as well as basements and foundations of a few homes. This is about 800 cfs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 PM PDT Tuesday the stage was 6.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to continue to rise to 6.8 feet late Thursday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.8 feet on 05/30/1983. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday by 130 PM PDT.
